definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: No, you won't have to eat peppers that are rated "volcanic" on the Scoville Scale.
sentences.chinese: 當然你不需要去喫火辣辣的辣椒。

sentences.english: My legs were tired with jumping and my face burned.
sentences.chinese: 我的雙腿蹦得累極了，臉也凍得火辣辣的。

sentences.english: Reiko pressed her hand to her burning cheek.
sentences.chinese: 麗考用手按着火辣辣發病的面頰。

sentences.english: Already they were sweating as the sun beat down upon them.
sentences.chinese: 太陽火辣辣地曬着他們，他們已是汗如泉湧。

sentences.english: This product is currently hot sold in Japan for man and woman market.
sentences.chinese: 目前在日本火辣辣熱賣中之專攻男女市場產品。

sentences.english: His cheek tingled from the slap.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉因捱了耳光而感到火辣辣的。

sentences.english: For a fraction of a second I stood there, my face burning.
sentences.chinese: 我在那兒站了一小會兒，臉火辣辣的。

sentences.english: The hot spices Burned his mouth and tongue.
sentences.chinese: 調味料辣得他的嘴和舌頭火辣辣的。

sentences.english: The sun beat down on us all day.
sentences.chinese: 驕陽整天火辣辣地曬着我們。

sentences.english: The ant gets its name form the burning sensation caused by its sting.
sentences.chinese: 螞蟻因爲其蟄刺蟄到人後火辣辣的感覺而得名。

sentences.english: She felt colour flame up in her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她感到臉上火辣辣地紅了起來。

sentences.english: All this is fiery radical writing.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些都走火辣辣的過激之作。

sentences.english: The Maotai wine burned in my throat.
sentences.chinese: 我喝了茅臺酒喉嚨裏火辣辣的。

sentences.english: Then she remembers feeling like she was on fire and smelling burning flesh.
sentences.chinese: 在這之後，她感覺火辣辣的，還聞到了烤肉的味道。

sentences.english: Had a burning of the holiday, the new semester has begun.
sentences.chinese: 過了一個火辣辣的假期，新的學期又開始了。

sentences.english: I downed my shot of mescal. I could feel it burn in my throat.
sentences.chinese: 我把手裏的龍舌蘭一口吞了，喉嚨裏火辣辣的。

definition: restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
burning hot/fiery/to have one's hair permed with hot curling tongs
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
variant of 紅彤彤|红彤彤[hong2 tong1 tong1]
